entries: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Leather Armor|XPHB}, {@item Sickle|XPHB}, 2 {@item Dagger|XPHB|Daggers}, {@item Wand|XPHB|Arcane Focus (Wand)}, {@item Explorer's Pack|XPHB}, 2 sets of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB}, and 5 GP; or (B) 100 GP

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: As a custodian of old folkways and the balance between worlds, you can cast Witch spells. Your magic works through subtle but emphatic suggestion, channeling your will to influence the wellbeing, fate, or opinions of beings who need a little (or not-so-little) nudge to exist in harmony with others.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB|cantrips} of your choice from the {@filter Witch spell list|spells|level=0|class=Witch (WBNW)}. {@i {@spell Cackle|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}}, {@i {@spell Guidance}} and {@i {@spell Mending}} are recommended (the {@i {@spell Cackle|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}} cantrip is included in the "New Spells" section at the end of this class). You gain additional witch {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB|cantrips} of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB|Cantrips} Known column of the Witch table.
Whenever you gain a Witch level, you can replace one of your {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB|cantrips} with another {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB|cantrip} of your choice from the Witch spell list.
When you reach Witch levels 4 and 10, you learn another Witch {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB|cantrip} of your choice, as shown in the {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB|Cantrips} Known column of the Witch table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Witch Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose four spells from the {@filter Witch spell list|spells|level=!0|class=Witch (WBNW)}. {@i {@spell Bane}}, {@i {@spell Cure Wounds}}, {@i {@spell Detect Magic}}, and {@i {@spell Witch's Grasp|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Witch levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Witch Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Witch spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 3 Witch, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of levels 1 or 2 in any combination.

If another Witch feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Witch spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change your list of prepared spells, replacing any of the spells with other Witch spells for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Witch spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells. Witches may also have unusual, homemade, or repurposed objects as their Arcane Focus, such as brooms, kitchen knives, kettles, dolls, or similar household objects. To use such an item as your {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB}, you must spend 1 hour in meditation dedicating it to that purpose.

entries.name: Curse Spells
entries: A witch's curse carries a personal grudge. Some features of the Witch covens imbue certain spells with additional potency. These spells are shown in the Curse Spells table.

classFeature.name: Witchcraft Tokens
entries: You bring a touch of magic to everyday materials and tasks, and as a result, the fruits of your labor bear a subtle—but potent—power. Savvy witches soon learn that common chores can be just as useful as flashier forms of spellcasting; they can channel magic just as easily by cooking up restorative meals, growing strange medicines in their gardens, weaving charm bracelets, and stitching protection into the seams of clothes. They also empower their familiars to aid them in spellcasting.

The minor results of a witch's craft—potions, salves, one-use charms, and favors—are commonly called tokens, and any given witch can expect to make countless numbers of them in their lifetime. Many witches make a living by trading tokens with those in need, although few ever become wealthy that way.

Any level 1 Witch spell that targets one or more creatures can be crafted into a token with 1 hour of labor using {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} or an {@item Herbalism Kit|XPHB}. To craft it, you must have an unexpended spell slot of a high enough level to cast the spell (you need not have the spell prepared) and you must succeed on a Wisdom check using your tools with a DC of 10 + the spell's level. On a failure, the item isn't created unless you expend a spell slot of the spell's level.

You can attempt to make a single token during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Tokens take a form appropriate to the tools you use to create them. An {@item Herbalism Kit|XPHB} might produce a potion or salve; {@item Cook's Utensils|XPHB} might produce a cupcake.

Once created, a creature holding the token can cast the spell from it using your spell save DC, {@variantrule Spell Attack|XPHB|spell attack} bonus, and spellcasting ability. If the spell requires {@condition Concentration}, the creature must concentrate. The token then loses its magical properties, becoming a mundane item of its kind.

You can maintain a number of active tokens equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. If you make an additional token while at your limit, the magic fades from your oldest token.

classFeature.name: Witch's Familiar
entries: A witch's familiar is their lifelong companion and friend. You can choose to form a magical connection with a willing {@creature Badger|XMM}, {@creature Bat|XMM}, {@creature Cat|XMM}, {@creature Crab|XMM}, {@creature Frog|XMM|Frog (toad)}, {@creature Goat|XMM}, {@creature Hawk|XMM}, {@creature Lizard|XMM}, {@creature Octopus|XMM}, {@creature Owl|XMM}, {@creature Quipper||Quipper (fish)}, {@creature Rat|XMM}, {@creature Raven|XMM}, {@creature Sea Horse}, {@creature Scorpion|XMM}, {@creature Spider|XMM}, {@creature Venomous Snake|XMM}, or {@creature Weasel|XMM|Weasel (fox)}, or {@filter any CR 0 creature|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0]} approved by your GM.

entries.name: Witch's Bond
entries: Your familiar has a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Witch level, or the number in their stat block (whichever is higher). They can speak (but not read or write) any one language you speak. Your familiar acts independently of you, but they generally heed your requests.

entries.name: Telepathic Connection
entries: You can communicate telepathically with your familiar regardless of distance. Additionally, as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can see through your familiar's eyes and hear what they hear until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses the familiar has.

entries.name: Magical Assistant
entries: When you cast a spell with a range of Touch, your familiar can deliver the spell as if they had cast the spell. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and they must use their {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack roll}, they use your attack modifier for the roll.

If you lose {@condition Concentration} on a spell as a result of taking damage or becoming {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB|incapacitated}, your familiar can temporarily concentrate on the spell in your stead. If they are within 100 feet of you when you lose {@condition Concentration}, they can transfer the {@condition Concentration} to themself as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}. At the start of your next turn, you can transfer {@condition Concentration} on the spell back to yourself as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Otherwise, the spell ends.

Your familiar can use your Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} bonus in place of their own if they must make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} to maintain {@condition Concentration}. The spell ends if they lose {@condition Concentration}.
Once your familiar takes over {@condition Concentration} in this way, they can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Combat and Revival
entries: In combat, they roll their own {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} and act on their own turn. When your familiar would be reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can expend a level 1+ spell slot to make them drop to 1 Hit Point instead (no action required), provided you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. If your familiar dies, their body vanishes, and you can perform a ritual to revive them during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. The ritual requires 10 GP of herbs or incense, and your familiar returns to life with all their {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you.

entries.name: One Familiar Only
entries: You can't have more than one familiar at a time. If you choose another animal as your witch's familiar, you lose your connection to your previous familiar.

classFeature.name: Retributive Curses
entries: Witches are quick to punish those who wrong them. A creature becomes a target for retribution when it transgresses against you in one of the following ways:

items: {@b Harm.} The creature attacks or deals damage to you, your familiar, or a creature holding a token or talisman you created.
{@b Threat.} The creature forces you to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw}.
{@b Betrayal.} The creature intentionally breaks a promise to you.

entries: As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when a creature within 60 feet of you commits such a transgression, you can place one of the following curses on it:

items: {@b Bloodguilt.} The first time on a turn that the target deals damage to another creature, it takes Psychic damage equal to 1d6 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.
{@b Leaden Shoes.} The target's movement speed is reduced to 5 feet and it can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attack}.
{@b Uncanny Jinx.} Whenever the target makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, it must subtract {@dice 1d4} from the total.

{@b Vengeful Gleam.} The target glows with a green witch-light that sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} in a 5-foot radius. It can't benefit from the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition, and attacks against it have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} if the attacker can see it.

entries: The curse lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if the cursed creature dies, you apply a different Retributive Curse to the creature, or you choose to end the curse as an action. You can use this feature twice, and regain expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

If you or your allies initiated a fight with the creature, it can make a Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} against your spell save DC. On a successful save, the curse has no effect but you don't expend a use of this feature.

entries.name: GM Sidebar: A Witch's Grudge
entries: Sometimes circumstances arise in which a creature transgresses against a witch who isn't present or is unable to exact retribution in the moment—for example, if someone breaks a promise to the witch while she isn't present, or strikes her and knocks her unconscious. In these cases, it makes sense for the DM to rule that a Witch can use their Retributive Curse feature against the creature the next time the Witch enters combat against it.

Moreover, some acts are so egregious to the cosmic balance that they warrant a more lasting punishment. A trusted ally's betrayal of their bond, the theft of an especially portentous artifact, or bringing violence to a place of lasting peace all might earn the transgressor an enduring curse. Using their narrative discretion, the GM may rule that the effects of a Retributive Curse last longer than 1 minute: a lunar cycle, a year and a day, or even indefinitely. In such cases, righting the wrong usually ends the curse, as do other means of cursebreaking.

classFeature.name: Witch Subclass
entries: You gain a Witch subclass of your choice, joining a coven of witches whose magic resonates with your craft. The Coven of the Claw, Coven of the Green, and Coven of the Heart subclasses are detailed after this class's description. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Witch levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Witch level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Witch levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Witchcraft Talismans
entries: When you put your back into your craft and devote a little part of yourself to what you're making, you can weave your magic into a talisman that will last forever. Many witches make talismans of clothing, though brooms, athames, keys, and tools are also popular—especially brooms as a means of fantastical conveyance for the witch themself. Most witches craft talismans specifically for companions, heroes, loved ones, or younger witches under their tutelage, but some guard their talismans jealously.

As an action while you can see a talisman, you can recover the sacrificed spell slot. The talisman ceases to be a magic item, and you regain that spell slot the next time you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Similarly, if the talisman is destroyed, you regain the spell slot when you finish your next {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
You always know the distance and direction to a talisman you created while you are on the same plane of existence. You can create the following kinds of talisman.

entries.name: Instilled Spell
entries: Any Witch spell that doesn't require a costly Material component can be crafted into a talisman if you have an unexpended spell slot of a high enough level to cast it (you need not have the spell prepared). To craft a talisman, you must spend 24 hours of labor (this time need not be continuous) and make a DC 20 Wisdom check using {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB}. On a success, you permanently sacrifice a spell slot of the spell's level to complete the talisman.

A creature holding the talisman can cast that spell from it, using your spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability. Once the talisman is used to cast its spell, it can't be used that way again until the next dawn.

You can add more spells to a talisman, or more uses of the same spell, with an additional 24 hours of labor, another Wisdom check using {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB}, and another sacrificed spell slot of the appropriate level.

entries.name: Create Magic Item
entries: Alternatively, you can sacrifice a level 3+ spell slot to craft an item from the Common and Uncommon Items table, or a level 6+ spell slot to craft an item from the Rare Items table. New magic items that Witches can craft as talismans are marked with an asterisk and detailed in the "New Magic Items" section at the end of this class.

entries.caption: Common and Uncommon Items
rows: {@item Amulet of Proof Against Detection and Location}

classFeature.name: Coven Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Witch Coven.

classFeature.name: Improved Tokens
entries: You can create tokens using level 2 spells.

classFeature.name: Willful Sanctum
entries: A witch's labor bears so much of their connection to magic that the very sticks, stones, walls, and hearth of their dwelling respond. You can spend 8 hours fashioning a place where you've taken a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} into a sanctum. If the place is already owned or inhabited, you must have permission from its owner to reside there. You determine the boundaries of your sanctum, but you must be able to traverse its perimeter in an hour or less (alternatively, it must fit in a 2,000-foot-radius area).

If you have a sanctum that's at least 7 days old, your presence helps ward it against magical and spiritual prying; you can cast {@spell Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum} within your sanctum without Material components. You always have {@spell Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum} prepared.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Witch levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Improved Retribution
entries: When you curse a target with your Retributive Curses feature, the curse now lasts for up to 10 minutes. Moreover, you gain the following additional curse options:

items: {@b Shared Suffering.} The target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. Each time it casts a spell or forces another creature to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw}, it takes {@dice 1d8} + your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} Poison damage.
{@b Enervation.} The target subtracts {@dice 1d8} from all its damage rolls.
{@b Muzzle.} The target can't use bite attacks or breath weapons, and it can't cast spells that require Verbal components.
{@b Painful Reflection.} The next time the target deals damage to a creature, it gains {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to one type of damage dealt (your choice) until the curse ends.

classFeature.name: Coven Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Witch Coven.

classFeature.name: Hallowed Sanctum
entries: You always have {@spell Hallow} prepared. You can cast it without Material components on one area within your sanctum. Additionally, a creature that tries to force its way into this area has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} it makes to ignore the spell's effects. If you designate a new sanctum, any {@spell Hallow} spell you cast on a previous sanctum with this feature immediately ends.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Witch levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Greater Tokens
entries: You can create tokens using level 3 spells.

classFeature.name: Coven Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Witch Coven.

classFeature.name: Greater Retribution
entries: When you curse a target with your Retributive Curses feature, the curse now lasts for up to 1 hour. Moreover, you gain the following additional curse option:

{@b Humbling Hex.} You cast {@spell Polymorph} on the target without expending a spell slot. On a failed save, you transform it into a Beast with Challenge Rating 0 that can survive in its current environment. When you cast {@spell Polymorph} in this way, it doesn't require {@condition Concentration}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Witch levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Shifting Sanctum
entries: You always have {@spell Imprisonment} prepared and can cast it without Material components while you are in your sanctum.
You also always have {@spell Demiplane} prepared and can cast it once in your sanctum with a duration of Permanent.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. {@feat Boon of Truesight|XPHB} is recommended.

classFeature.name: True Craft
entries: You can now create a {@classFeature Witchcraft Tokens|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|1||token} or {@classFeature Witchcraft Talismans|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|5||talisman} using a spell of level 8 or lower. Additionally, the spell you choose can be from any class list, but you must expend (or risk, in the case of tokens) a spell slot one level higher than the spell you choose.

entries.name: The Witch
entries: Standing on moss-covered steps in the path of an advancing ogre, a young shrine maiden carefully pours a hot cup of tea. She whispers a word of thanks into the rising steam, and as she raises the drink, the ogre drops the greatclub from his hand as he sits in wonder, gazing at the offering.

Peering over a bubbling cauldron, a mother watches her child breathe raggedly under a patchwork quilt. A crow alights upon her shoulder with white-blossoming herbs in its beak, and she sighs with relief as she adds them to the magic brew.

Striding through the great mead hall, a wizened crone strikes terror into the hearts of once-brave warriors. She points a bony finger at the old king, and as shadow and fire leap to the fury of her cackling command, the king dies knowing he has earned this fate.

Witches are powerful mages as well as devoted caretakers, combining patience, insight, and subtlety with extraordinary willfulness. While other spellcasters might use magic in grand gestures that bend the world to their whims, a witch's power works in harmony with the people, plants, animals, and magical forces around them. The practice of witchcraft is often rooted in everyday rituals and chores, emphasizing the value in doing things with care and deliberation rather than taking shortcuts.

entries.name: Powerful Consequences
entries: Witches are infamous for their curses, but they don't curse others on a whim. A witch's curse is most often a consequence for causing harm or engaging in disrespectful behavior, to the witch themself or the people and places under their care. Curses range from a minor, temporary rebuke—causing a bully to startle at their own shadow—to permanent ramifications meted out as justice for wicked acts—transforming a greedy poacher into a helpless deer. If the recipient of the curse demonstrates increased understanding and remorse for their actions, the witch may be persuaded to lift the spell.

entries.name: Connection and Community
entries: A home—both a location and the people who live there—is a foundational part of witchcraft. A witch often serves as a protector, counselor, and healer to the people (and animals, plants, and spirits) who live near them, whether or not this role is sanctioned by the local authorities. Often, this spellwork is seamlessly incorporated into simple home goods and handcrafts, familiar gifts that comfort their recipients and lie dormant until needed. While a witch doesn't necessarily stay in one place, they understand the importance of community, and work to preserve balance between people, the natural world, and supernatural forces wherever they go.

entries.name: Becoming a Witch
entries: When making a Witch, consider your character's relationship to the world and the creatures around them. How closely do they live to the subjects of their care, and what would it take to make your Witch break away from them? How did they meet their familiar, and what do they do for each other? What everyday rituals ground them in their work?

Perhaps your character is new to witchcraft, or perhaps they spent years as an apprentice learning traditions, rituals, and hexes from their mentor. If your character had a mentor, what was your relationship with that Witch, and what lessons did they impart to you beyond the practices of spellcasting and magic?

subclassFeature.name: Coven of the Claw
entries: Living far from civilization in remote places of wilderness and isolation, the Coven of the Claw's wisdom is piercing, contemplative, and often ascetic. Claw witches tend to their fellow outsiders, trappers and hunters and hermits with no one else to watch over them, and to those compelled to travel the hard path, deep and far, to seek them out. Their care is harsh and truthful, but they fiercely protect their territory and those within it against harm and exploitation.

subclassFeature.name: Claw Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Coven of the Claw Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Coven of the Claw Spells
rows: {@spell Animal Friendship}, {@spell Animal Messenger}, {@spell Poison Spray}, {@spell Speak With Animals}, {@spell Spider Climb}

subclassFeature.name: Curse of the Claw
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can curse a creature within 60 feet of you and mark it as your prey for 1 hour. While the creature is cursed in this way:

items: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the first {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack roll} against it you make on a turn.
You don't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attack} from it.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any Wisdom ({@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival}) check you make to find it.

entries: You can use this feature twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Crimson Gift
entries: Witches of the Coven of the Claw are trained for battle as few other witches are. When you choose this coven, you gain the following benefits:

items: While you aren't wearing Medium or Heavy armor or wielding a Shield, your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Wisdom modifiers.
Your Hit Point maximum increases by 2, and each time you gain a level in the witch class your Hit Point maximum increases by an additional 1 Hit Point.
You can use Wisdom instead of Strength or Dexterity for your weapon attack and damage rolls, including unarmed strikes.

entries: In addition, your physical form now hides a nature that no longer belongs to the world of civilization. You can grow fearsome claws, fangs, spines, horns, or different natural weapons of your choice. When you make a melee attack using a natural weapon, you can instead choose to make a melee spell attack that deals {@dice 1d6} Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage, as appropriate to the natural weapon you chose, and you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage.
You can change these adaptations to your form as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Fierce Familiar
entries: You always have {@i {@spell Call to the Hunter|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}} prepared, and you can cast it as a Transmutation that targets your familiar and changes its game statistics to match the {@creature Allied Hunter|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch} stat block. If you do, the spell's duration becomes 1 minute, it doesn't require {@condition Concentration}, and its maximum {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} increase by 10.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Crimson Gift
entries: When you hit with a melee spell attack using your {@subclassFeature Crimson Gift|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|Claw|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|3} feature, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage.

subclassFeature.name: Red Frenzy
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, so long as both attacks are made using your natural weapons.

subclassFeature.name: On the Hunt
entries: The hunter's tactics. The predator's instincts. The thrill of the chase. Pursuing your prey is second nature to you, as a creature of the wilds yourself. You gain one of the following feature options of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Coven of the Green
entries: The Coven of the Green are custodians of ancient medicinal wisdom, showing their care by attentively cultivating things that grow and transforming them into nourishment, charms, salves and poultices. They understand best the symmetry between people and the natural world, the dancing of bees and the games that hares and foxes play, and how the roots of trees and fungi lace together and support a stump that's been cut. But being so aware of the big picture places them beyond and apart from it; green witches tend to settle well outside of towns and villages, if only a short trip away. A gardener tends the flower beds, but she isn't herself a flower.

subclassFeature.name: Green Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Coven of the Green Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Coven of the Green Spells
rows: {@spell Barkskin}, {@spell Druidcraft}, {@spell Entangle}, {@spell Goodberry}, {@spell Poison Spray}, {@spell Spike Growth}

subclassFeature.name: Curse of the Grasping Green
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can curse a creature within 60 feet of you for 1 hour. For the duration, a leeching vine grows around the target, and when the creature takes damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to choose another creature within 60 feet of you to regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half the triggering damage dealt to the cursed target. If the target is within your Veil of the Green, two creatures of your choice regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} instead of one.

As an action, the cursed creature can make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} against your spell save DC to rip the leeching vine off of its body. On a success, the creature takes Poison damage equal to your Witch level, and a creature of your choice within 60 feet regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your Witch level.
You can use this feature twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Veil of the Green
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can exude pollen or spores in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} that protects allies or hinders enemies. Choose one of the following veils.

items: {@i {@b Deep Roots.}} Whenever creatures of your choice in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} make a Strength or Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw}, they add {@dice 1d4} to the save.

{@i {@b Green Dreams.}} At the end of your turn, you can force one creature in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} to succeed on a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} against your spell save DC or gain 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level, to a maximum of 1 level. This maximum increases when you reach Witch levels 5 (2 levels), 9 (3 levels), 13 (4 levels) and 17 (5 levels).

{@i {@b Tangled Tread.}} The ground in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for your enemies. When you move or this effect ends, the ground you affected is covered in moss.

entries: The {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} continues until you end the veil (no action required), gain the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, or use this feature again to choose a different veil.

subclassFeature.name: Venom Ward
entries: You and your familiar gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage and you both have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throws} to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Gifts
entries: Plants around you grow faster while your dreaming mind works on them. When you plant seeds or clippings in fertile soil at the start of a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, they grow as if 30 days have passed when you finish that {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. They must be exposed to sunlight or moonlight, and they must be within 30 feet of you for the duration of your rest.

If you grow herbs with this feature, the next time you prepare spells, you can create a number of potions equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} from herbs that you grow, chosen from the following options:If you grow herbs with this feature, the next time you prepare spells, you can create a number of potions equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} from herbs that you grow, chosen from the following options:

items: {@item Elixir of Health}
{@item Potion of Animal Friendship}
{@item Potion of Fire Breath}
{@item Potion of Growth}
{@item Potion of Healing}
{@item Potion of Mind Reading}
{@item Potion of Resistance} (you choose the damage type for a potion when you create it)
{@item Potion of Water Breathing}

entries: Potions that you create with this feature lose their potency in 24 hours if unused.

subclassFeature.name: Bloodthorn
entries: Your magical bindings sprout pernicious thorns. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can deal {@dice 2d6} + your Wisdom modifier Piercing damage to a creature that has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, or {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} conditions from a Witch spell you cast, is cursed by your {@subclassFeature Curse of the Grasping Green|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|Green|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|3} feature, or is in {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} you create.

subclassFeature.name: Verdant Veil
entries: Your Veil of the Green is now a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, and each veil now gains an additional effect:

items: {@i {@b Deep Roots.}} At the end of your turn, you can choose one creature in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} to gain {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} until the start of your next turn or until it leaves the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}.

{@i {@b Green Dreams.}} When a creature fails the Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} for this effect, it gains 2 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels instead of 1. If it fails the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} by 5 or more, it gains the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

{@i {@b Tangled Tread.}} When an enemy attempts to move out of the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, it must succeed on a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} against your spell save DC or be unable to move outside the area this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Coven of the Heart
entries: Of all witches, those of the Coven of the Heart take the most interest in the lives and troubles of ordinary people, and they excel as matchmakers, advice-givers, and gossips. Whether they dwell in the charmingly odd house at the edge of town or in the attic apartments above a busy store, heart witches tend to live among the people that their magic serves and become fixtures of community life, attending town halls and festivals and helping out around town until others hardly think there's anything remarkable about a witch living among them.

subclassFeature.name: Heart Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Coven of the Heart spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Coven of the Heart Spells
rows: {@spell Calm Emotions}, {@spell Healing Word}, {@spell Prestidigitation}, {@spell Sanctuary}, {@spell Spare the Dying}, {@spell Warding Bond}

subclassFeature.name: Curse Upon the Heartless
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can curse a creature within 60 feet of you for 1 hour. For the duration, whenever the creature deals damage, you can roll a d6 and reduce the damage it deals to one target by that amount. You reduce the damage by {@dice 2d6} if the target is an Undead or a Fiend.
Once you reduce damage in this way, you can't do so again until the start of your next turn.
When you reach level 10, you reduce the damage by {@dice 2d6}, or {@dice 3d6} if the target is an Undead or a Fiend.
You can use this feature twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Heart's Gifts
entries: When you cast {@spell Spare the Dying} or a spell that restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to a creature, you can expend a number of Hit Point Dice up to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to roll an equal number of d6s and add the total to the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} one target of your spell regains.

subclassFeature.name: Overflowing Heart
entries: You channel your true feelings into your magic. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can select a number of willing creatures up to your Wisdom modifier. When you cast a spell that targets one or more of these creatures, you can replace one Verbal or Somatic component, or one Material component worth up to 500 GP. You replace that component with the targets laughter or tears, or a shared kiss or embrace.

subclassFeature.name: Sympathetic Bond
entries: The bonds of the heart care nothing for distance. When a creature gives you an object that symbolizes their friendship or love, such as a lock of hair or a rose in bloom, you can target them with spells you cast as if you can see and touch them while you hold the object, regardless of the spell's normal range. If the creature's friendship or love toward you ends, the object loses this feature and you are aware of it.

subclassFeature.name: Witch's Grace
entries: The power of your sympathy and empathy can overwhelm the hardest of hearts, making you a powerful force for reconciliation. When a creature that you and your allies haven't harmed or insulted deals damage to you or an ally of yours that you can see or hear, or forces you or an ally you can see or hear to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw}, you can use an action on your turn to implore the creature to cease hostility.

At the start of your next turn, if the creature has not been attacked, damaged, or verbally threatened by you and your allies since you used this feature, it feels the presence of a curse eager to inflict consequences if it harms you or your allies.

For the next 24 hours, or until you or your allies attack, threaten, or force the creature to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw}, the act of harming you or your allies causes the curse to immediately take effect. While cursed in this way, the creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} for 24 hours, including on the action that triggered the curse.

Creatures that can't understand a language can't be affected by this feature. If you or your allies have harmed or insulted a creature but made sufficient amends (as determined by the GM), you can use this feature as if you have not done harm or given insult.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 7+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Coven of the Wicked
entries: Few witches set out to be wicked—this coven is a doom that befalls witches whose care turns to selfishness and whose magic sours with misuse. Members of this coven like to paint themselves as misunderstood victims, but it's not tragedy that turns a witch's heart to darkness—it's the inability to let go of how they've been wronged, an aggrieved fixation on using witchcraft to punish transgressors rather than to redress trespasses.

The Coven of the Wicked is an optional ruleset that demonstrates how witches sometimes slide into wickedness. Like a paladin who breaks their oath, it's largely a tool for developing villainous NPCs, and a player who wishes to play a member of this coven should have a discussion with the GM about whether or not it's narratively appropriate to begin changing their coven or even to start a campaign as a witch who's already fallen.

Similarly, if a Witch player character seems to be developing tendencies towards wickedness, the GM might have a conversation with the player about whether or not they're turning wicked, as below. In general, exploring the Coven of the Wicked makes the most sense in a long-term campaign with complex moral themes, where arcs of wickedness and redemption have time to arise organically and come to a satisfying conclusion.

subclassFeature.name: Turning Wicked
entries: When a Witch begins to go wicked, their magic warps, and they lose access to some of their coven spells.

{@i {@b Replacing Your Coven Spells.}} When the first signs of your wickedness peek through, pick one of the coven spells you've been granted and replace it with one of the Coven of the Wicked spells of the same level below. You can also replace a {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB|cantrip} granted by your coven with {@i {@spell Cackle|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}} or {@i {@spell Chill Touch}}.

Each time you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, replace another of your coven spells if you've continued down the path of wickedness. If you and your GM agree that a particular act of wickedness would prompt a larger shift in your character's magic, you can replace more than one spell.

entries.caption: Coven of the Wicked Spells
rows: {@spell Melf's Acid Arrow}, {@spell Command}, {@spell Detect Thoughts}, {@spell Inflict Wounds}

entries: {@i {@b Replacing Your Coven Features.}} When half of your original coven spells are gone, change your coven to the Coven of the Wicked, replacing your old coven features with those below. Hereafter, if you reach level 5, 7, or 9 in the Witch class, you learn one spell of your choice you would have learned from your previous coven and one spell of your choice from the Coven of the Wicked Spells table.

subclassFeature.name: Rest for the Wicked
entries: A witch who has turned to wickedness can only turn away from it through hard work and genuine remorse, though they need not do so alone—the care and support of others are vital to this process. The witch must dedicate themself to rehabilitation, striving to repair the damage caused by their cruel acts and resist further pettiness and spite.

{@i {@b Regaining Your Coven Spells.}} Magic, like milk, can't unspoil, but the spilling of it can be forgiven. Whenever you make amends for a cruel or destructive act you committed in the past, or earn the forgiveness of those worst hurt by it, you can regain one of your original coven spells that you lost. Any spells you gained from the {@subclassFeature Turning Wicked|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|Wicked|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|3} feature remain after rehabilitation—as does the temptation to use them.

{@i {@b Regaining Your Coven Features.}} During the process of rehabilitation, you lose access to your Coven of the Wicked features—though these features return if you renege on their desire to mend your ways. When you regain all your original coven spells, you can change covens and regain your original coven's features, losing any remaining Coven of the Wicked features.

subclassFeature.name: Curse of Spite
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can curse a creature within 60 feet of you for 1 hour. For the duration, when the creature fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, they take Psychic or Necrotic damage (your choice) equal to the difference between the result of their roll and the {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} of the target or DC of the test.

When you reach level 10, the power of your malice actively sabotages those who've earned your ire. Whenever the target would succeed on a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to subtract your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} from the total.
You can use this feature twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Loathsome Gifts
entries: In your wickedness, you feed on death and misery. When an enemy dies while affected by your {@subclassFeature Curse of Spite|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|Wicked|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|3} feature, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level equal to no more than half your Witch level (round up), and none of the slots can be level 6 or higher.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Detect Mercy
entries: If a curse you cast is lifted by {@spell Remove Curse}, {@spell Greater Restoration}, or similar magic, you immediately become aware that it's been lifted.

subclassFeature.name: Curse-Token
entries: Additionally, your curses are persistent in their power. When you cast a curse spell with a level no higher than your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} that requires {@condition Concentration} on a creature or creatures, you can anchor the curse to a nonmagical Tiny or Small object that isn't being worn or carried by another creature. For the duration, you can't lose {@condition Concentration} on the spell unless the object is destroyed or you anchor another curse to the same object. The object has AC 12, HP 35, a damage threshold of 20, and Immunity to Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Malicious Bond
entries: Your unbounded malice cares nothing for distance. Using a lock of hair, nail clippings, or other body part from a creature, you can target it with a spell as if you can see and touch it, so long as the creature is on the same plane as you. An item with an active spell from your {@subclassFeature Curse-Token|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|Wicked|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|6} feature also satisfies this requirement for a creature the {@subclassFeature Curse-Token|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|Wicked|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|6||Curse-Token's} spell affects.
When you use a creature's body part to target them with a spell, it is consumed by the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Twisted by Cruelty
entries: Your wicked disposition brings on changes to your physical form, as you embody the most vengeful aspects of nature. You gain the following benefits:

items: Any {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} against you that doesn't include Radiant damage is a normal hit instead.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throws} to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} and {@condition Stunned|XPHB} conditions.
You can see normally in {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, both magical and nonmagical, out to a distance of 60 feet.

Nonmagical plants within 30 feet of you wither after 1 hour in your presence. If you live in one location for at least a year, nonmagical plants within 5 miles of that place wither and the soil becomes barren.

optionalfeature.name: Lash Out
entries: As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you take damage from a creature within 30 feet of you, you can move up to your Speed and make a melee spell attack with your {@subclassFeature Crimson Gift|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|Claw|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|3} feature against the triggering creature. Alternatively, your {@creature Allied Hunter|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch} (or familiar transformed by your Fierce Familiar feature) can make a Hunter's Strike attack against the creature.

optionalfeature.name: Lurk
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn, you deal any damage, or you force a creature to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw}. If you hit with an attack while {@condition Invisible|XPHB}, you deal an extra {@damage 4d6} damage. You can use this feature once, and regain the use of it when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, or expend a 2+ level spell slot as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Red in Tooth and Claw
entries: When you damage a {@subclassFeature Curse of the Claw|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|Claw|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|3} target that isn't an Undead or a Construct with a melee spell attack, you inflict a wound that causes it to lose 5 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns. The first time on subsequent turns you hit a target wounded with this feature, the {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} it loses at the start of each turn increase by 5. This damage ends if the creature is no longer affected by your {@subclassFeature Curse of the Claw|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|Claw|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|3}; you can also choose to end the effect at any time. A creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check (the DC of this check equals your spell save DC).

optionalfeature.name: Steady Will
entries: You can't lose {@condition Concentration} on curse spells as a result of taking damage. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throws} to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, and {@condition Stunned|XPHB} conditions on yourself.
Whenever you gain a Witch level, you can replace the chosen option with another one.

spell.name: Animate Hut

components.m: leg and foot bones from one creature

entries: When you cast this spell, you touch one building of up to 30 feet long by 30 feet wide and up to two stories tall. You must have either some claim to ownership or residency of the building or permission from its owners, or else the spell fails and has no effect.

The building becomes a Construct that follows your verbal commands and acts immediately after your turn in {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}. Ten-foot-long legs resembling the creature whose bones you used as a Material component (or chicken legs, if you cast this spell without Material components) sprout under the building, and it gains a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 40 feet. The building can stand up or sit down using half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and it must sit down to lower its doorways to ground level.

While you concentrate on the spell, the building can use its action to stomp its legs, making a melee weapon attack using your spell attack bonus; on a hit it deals {@damage 3d10} Bludgeoning damage. The building has AC 15, 100 HP, and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage. It uses your {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} bonuses. If the building is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the spell ends and it settles to the ground.

If your {@status Concentration|XPHB} on the spell ends, the building remains animate and continues to follow your verbal directions for the remainder of the spell's duration, but it can no longer take actions.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you use a level 8+ spell slot to cast this spell, you can give the building wings in addition to legs, and it gains a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

spell.name: Breath of Belladonna

m.text: three belladonna berries, which the spell consumes

entries: You consume the belladonna berries used as a Material component, taking 3 Poison damage, and breathe out a poisonous cloud. Each creature in a 15-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} originating from you must make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw}. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d10} Poison damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage only. A creature that doesn't need to breathe automatically succeeds on its {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: If you use a level 3+ spell slot to cast this spell, the damage you deal increases by {@dice 1d10} for each spell slot level above 2. The damage you take doesn't increase.

spell.name: Cackle
entries: You cackle wildly at one creature within range that can hear you, unleashing the power of your scorn and animosity. The target must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} or take {@damage 1d8} Psychic damage and have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|ability check} or {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} based on Strength or Dexterity it makes before the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Call to the Hunter
entries: You can call an allied Beast to your side in times of need, drawing on your reciprocal connection to the living things around you. When you summon this ally, choose its native environment: Air, Land, or Water. The creature uses the {@creature Allied Hunter|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch} stat block and has the form of an animal native to the chosen environment, which determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

In combat, it shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it defends itself against hostile creatures or takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action, using its movement to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a level 3+ spell slot, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Cleansing Crystal

m.text: a gem worth at least 50 gp

entries: You imbue a crystal with magic to absorb harmful influences. For the duration of the spell, when a creature carrying the crystal would take damage as a result of a spell or {@variantrule Magical Effect|XPHB|magical effect} in the space it occupies at the start of its turn, the crystal reduces the damage it takes by {@dice 2d6}. When the creature would make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} to avoid an effect based on the space it occupies at the start of its turn, it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw}.

For the spell's duration, when a creature carrying the crystal would take Necrotic, Poison, or Psychic damage, you can end the spell as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to give the creature {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the triggering damage type until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a level 4+ spell slot, creatures within 10 feet of the crystal also gain its benefits.

spell.name: Create Poppet
entries: When you cast this spell, you fashion the Material components into a Tiny doll (or pull the doll from your shadow if you cast it without Material components). While you hold this doll, you can take any of the following actions: {@variantrule Healing|XPHB} Gift. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose one creature you can see within 15 feet of you. That creature regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entries.name: Cleansing Gift
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose one creature you can see within 15 feet of you. You can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, or {@condition Stunned|XPHB}.

entries.name: Curse-Warding Gift
entries: As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you are targeted by a curse spell, you negate its effect on you.

When you use the doll for the third time, it is destroyed, leaving its heart behind in the form of a seed. Until the spell ends, any creature can eat the seed as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. A creature that does so gains {@dice 2d8} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

spell.name: Miser's Menace
entries: When you cast this spell, choose a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} or become cursed for the duration of the spell. While the target is cursed, it is compelled to give away all of its wealth, possessions, and positions of power to those who lack them, gifting at least ten percent of its wealth to each non-Beast creature it encounters.

If the target has broken its end of a bargain with you, or refused your polite request for food and shelter despite having done it no harm, you can cast this spell as an action and the effect is permanent, ending only when the curse is broken or the target has nothing but rags to its name.

spell.name: Spellwarping Curse
entries: You place a curse on a creature within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} or become cursed for the duration of the spell. While cursed in this way, the creature takes {@dice 1d8} + its spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1) Psychic damage each time it casts a spell or uses a magical feature that deals damage or forces a creature to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw}. {@spell Remove Curse} spells that the target casts on itself can't remove this curse.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a level 6+ spell slot and the target of this spell has ever targeted you with a harmful spell or {@variantrule Magical Effect|XPHB|magical effect} against your will, they have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} and the effect is permanent unless removed by {@spell Remove Curse}, {@spell Greater Restoration}, or similar magic. You can also choose to end the spell by using an action to dismiss it.

spell.name: Swineskin
entries: Choose a Humanoid within range that you can see or hear. The target must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} or become cursed. While cursed, the target is shape-shifted into a Beast form for the duration. That form can be any Beast you choose that has a {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} of 1 or lower. The target's game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen Beast, but the target retains its alignment, personality, {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}. The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the anatomy of its new form, and it can't speak or cast spells.
The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't use or otherwise benefit from any of that equipment.

The spell ends if the target is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. When you cast this  spell using a level 6+ spell slot, if the target has eaten your food or slept in your home within the past 24 hours, or if it has shown unkindness to another creature of the chosen form in the past 24 hours, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} and the effect is permanent unless removed by {@spell Remove Curse}, {@spell Greater Restoration}, or similar magic. You can also choose to end the spell by using an action to dismiss it.
A creature cursed permanently by this spell regains the ability to speak after it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

spell.name: Tongue-Tie
entries: Choose one creature within range that you can see or hear. The target must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} or become cursed for the duration of the spell. When you cast the spell, choose a topic of conversation. While the target remains cursed, whenever it attempts to speak about the chosen topic, you, or this spell, a phenomenon of your choice spills forth from its lips instead of words:

items: Tiny toads, snakes, moths, or other vermin
Short-lived wildflowers in full bloom
Black filth or bile
Fairy tales and nursery rhymes
Unflattering, unrelated truths about the target or those they are addressing

entries: Attempts to circumvent the curse by writing about the subject result in crude drawings of the chosen phenomenon. If the target can communicate telepathically or another creature reads its mind, it can communicate about the curse that way.

If you have caught the target in a lie, or if it was rude or ungrateful after you granted a request from it, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw}, the spell doesn't require {@status Concentration|XPHB}, and the effect is permanent unless removed by {@spell Remove Curse}, {@spell Greater Restoration}, or similar magic. You can also choose to end the spell by using an action to dismiss it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a level 3+ spell slot, you can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Verdant Slumber

time.condition: which you take when a creature within range is reduced to 0 HP or fails a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB}

entries: With a burst of power, you preserve a creature in mortal peril in magical slumber. The creature instantly falls asleep and has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to all damage for the duration of the spell. It has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 24 hours, then awakens as if it had finished a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also end the spell prematurely as an action, awakening the creature with 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.

If you move the creature to an area of fertile soil and natural growth, the duration of its slumber extends to a year and a day, as moss and vines grow over it. When you sleep within 60 feet of the creature, you can communicate with it in dreams. Many creatures preserved in this way are willing to share knowledge in exchange for eventual release, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma checks that you make to interact with it.

You can extend the duration of the creature's slumber by another year and a day by casting this spell again on the day that the duration would end. Otherwise, it wakes as if it had finished a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

spell.name: Witch's Grasp
entries: You clench your hand in a grasping motion toward a creature within range, wrapping the target with twisting ribbons of shadow. The target must succeed on a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} or have the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition and be held in place for the duration. A creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by this spell can take an action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition Grappled|XPHB}.

If the target of this spell has attacked you or forced you to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} within the last minute and has never been damaged by you, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw}. On a failure, you can choose for the target to take {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage as part of the casting of this spell, and an additional {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns while {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by this spell.
The spell ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a level 2+ spell slot, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Wyrding
entries: In a fit of shakes and spasms, you take on a monstrous semi-humanoid shape unique to you and your magic. When you cast this spell, you gain 20 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. Describe your new form and choose one of the following benefits:

items: Huge, molting feathers and a {@variantrule Flying|XPHB|flying speed} of 30 feet
Squamous skin, the ability to breathe water, and a swimming speed of 60 feet
Shaggy fur hide and an AC of 13 + your Wisdom modifier.

entries: For the duration of the spell, you gain the chosen qualities and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength and Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throws} and {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|ability checks}. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within reach. On a hit, you deal {@damage 2d10} acid damage.

You can end the Wyrding early as an action. If the spell doesn't end early, you become cursed until the curse is lifted by {@spell Remove Curse}, {@spell Greater Restoration}, or similar magic. While cursed in this way, you remain trapped in your Wyrding form, and you lose the ability to speak, read, write, understand language, or cast spells with Verbal components.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a level 5+ spell slot, the {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} it grants increase by 5 and the damage you deal with your melee spell attack increases by {@dice 1d10} for each spell level above 4.

hp.special: 20 (Air only) or 30 (Land and Water only) + 10 for each spell level above 3

trait.name: Cunning Ally
entries: The hunter has Advantage on attack rolls against a creature that has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, or {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} conditions, or that is under the effects of a curse you place or a curse spell you cast.

trait.name: Curse Eater
entries: Once per turn, when the hunter deals damage to a creature that is under the effects of a curse you place or a curse spell that you cast, the hunter regains Hit Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

trait.name: Aquatic Adaption (Water Only)
entries: The hunter can breathe only underwater. It has Advantage on ability checks and saving throws that rely on Dexterity while in aquatic environments.

trait.name: Evasion (Air Only)
entries: When the hunter is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Tenacious (Land Only)
entries: The hunter has Advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hunter makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

action.name: Hunter's Strike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 4 + summonSpellLevel} Piercing damage, and if the hunter's environment is Land, the target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape DC equals your spell save DC).

item.name: Bauble Trap
entries: Multiple variations of this item exist, as listed below:

items: {@item Bauble Trap (Uncommon)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}
{@item Bauble Trap (Rare)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}

item.name: Bauble Trap (Uncommon)
entries: These talismans are purpose-made to divert malicious spells from their intended subject and ensnare them for future use. It might take the form of a sealed jar of honey or wine, a complex stitching pattern, or a hollow pearl of rolled beeswax. Regardless of its design, a Bauble Trap always includes a strand of the protected subject's hair.

entries.name: Thwart
entries: The attuned creature adds {@dice 1d4} to its {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throws} against spells of which it is the sole target. If it succeeds, the spell fails and has no effect, and is stored within the Bauble Trap, which loses this property.

entries.name: Unleash
entries: Thereafter, a creature that breaks the Bauble Trap  or is struck by it (as an improvised thrown weapon) releases the spell and becomes its new target. The Bauble Trap  is then destroyed.

An Uncommon Bauble Trap can hold a spell of level 5 or lower. A Rare Bauble Trap can hold a spell of any level. When creating a Bauble Trap, a witch can name a specific spell against which the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} bonus increases to {@dice 2d6}.

item.name: Bauble Trap (Rare)
entries: These talismans are purpose-made to divert malicious spells from their intended subject and ensnare them for future use. It might take the form of a sealed jar of honey or wine, a complex stitching pattern, or a hollow pearl of rolled beeswax. Regardless of its design, a Bauble Trap always includes a strand of the protected subject's hair.

entries.name: Thwart
entries: The attuned creature adds {@dice 1d4} to its {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throws} against spells of which it is the sole target. If it succeeds, the spell fails and has no effect, and is stored within the Bauble Trap, which loses this property.

entries.name: Unleash
entries: Thereafter, a creature that breaks the Bauble Trap  or is struck by it (as an improvised thrown weapon) releases the spell and becomes its new target. The Bauble Trap  is then destroyed.

An Uncommon Bauble Trap can hold a spell of level 5 or lower. A Rare Bauble Trap can hold a spell of any level. When creating a Bauble Trap, a witch can name a specific spell against which the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} bonus increases to {@dice 2d6}.

item.name: Craftwork Grimoire
entries: Multiple variations of this item exist, as listed below:

items: {@item Craftwork Grimoire (Uncommon)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}
{@item Craftwork Grimoire (Rare)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}
{@item Craftwork Grimoire (Very Rare)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}

item.name: Craftwork Grimoire (Uncommon)
entries: While holding this book, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} DCs of your Witch spells.

In addition, you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|proficiency} with one set of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice, and you can maintain 1 extra {@classFeature Witchcraft Tokens|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|1||Witchcraft Token}, if you create it using the chosen tools.

item.name: Craftwork Grimoire (Rare)
entries: While holding this book, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells, and you gain a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} DCs of your Witch spells.

In addition, you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|proficiency} with one set of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice, and you can maintain 1 extra {@classFeature Witchcraft Tokens|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|1||Witchcraft Token}, if you create it using the chosen tools.

item.name: Craftwork Grimoire (Very Rare)
entries: While holding this book, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells, and you gain a +3 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} DCs of your Witch spells.

In addition, you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|proficiency} with one set of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice, and you can maintain 1 extra {@classFeature Witchcraft Tokens|Witch|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch|1||Witchcraft Token}, if you create it using the chosen tools.

item.name: Grandmother's Traveling Cloak
entries: This patchwork, quilted cloak smells faintly of hearth and home cooking. While wearing it, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Cozy
entries: You automatically succeed on {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throws} against extreme cold and extreme heat, and the cloak keeps you dry unless you are immersed in water.

entries.name: Focus
entries: You can use the cloak as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells.

entries.name: Shelter
entries: You can cast {@spell Rope Trick|XPHB} with a duration of 8 hours. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Hearth Keeper's Ladle
entries: Multiple variations of this item exist, as listed below:

items: {@item Hearth Keeper's Ladle (Uncommon)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}
{@item Hearth Keeper's Ladle (Rare)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}
{@item Hearth Keeper's Ladle (Very Rare)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}

item.name: Hearth Keeper's Ladle (Uncommon)
entries: While holding this ladle, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} DCs of your witch spells determined by the ladle's rarity.

In addition, as an action you can use the ladle to cast {@spell Create Food and Water|XPHB}. The food created in this way is a delicious soup or stew of your choice. Once the ladle is used to cast the spell, it can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Hearth Keeper's Ladle (Rare)
entries: While holding this ladle, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells, and you gain a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} DCs of your witch spells determined by the ladle's rarity.

In addition, as an action you can use the ladle to cast {@spell Create Food and Water|XPHB}. The food created in this way is a delicious soup or stew of your choice. Once the ladle is used to cast the spell, it can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Hearth Keeper's Ladle (Very Rare)
entries: While holding this ladle, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells, and you gain a +3 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} DCs of your witch spells determined by the ladle's rarity.

In addition, as an action you can use the ladle to cast {@spell Create Food and Water|XPHB}. The food created in this way is a delicious soup or stew of your choice. Once the ladle is used to cast the spell, it can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Staff of the Coven
entries: This Staff can be wielded as a magic Quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +2 bonus to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}, {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throws}, and spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls}.

The Staff has 20 Charges and regains {@dice 2d8 + 4} expended Charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last Charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the Staff retains its +2 bonus to {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and damage rolls but loses all other properties. On a 20, the Staff regains {@dice 1d8 + 2} Charges.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding the Staff, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast one of the spells on the Staff of the Coven Spells table, using your spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and level. The table indicates how many Charges you must expend to cast the spell.

entries.name: Punishing Curse
entries: When a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you damages you or forces you to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cast {@spell Bestow Curse} on the creature, ignoring the spell's normal range (paying its Charge cost as normal). When you cast the spell in this way, it doesn't require {@condition Concentration} and has a duration of 1 minute, but ends early if you cast the spell again.

item.name: Talon Athame
entries: Multiple variations of this item exist, as listed below:

items: {@item Talon Athame (Uncommon)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}
{@item Talon Athame (Rare)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}
{@item Talon Athame (Very Rare)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}

item.name: Talon Athame (Uncommon)
entries: While holding this magic weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} DCs of your Witch spells. In addition, you can use the weapon as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells.
In addition, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend and roll one Hit Die to deal extra Necrotic damage equal to the number rolled.

item.name: Talon Athame (Rare)
entries: While holding this magic weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you gain a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} DCs of your Witch spells. In addition, you can use the weapon as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells.
In addition, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend and roll one Hit Die to deal extra Necrotic damage equal to the number rolled.

item.name: Talon Athame (Very Rare)
entries: While holding this magic weapon, you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you gain a +3 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} DCs of your Witch spells. In addition, you can use the weapon as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells.
In addition, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend and roll one Hit Die to deal extra Necrotic damage equal to the number rolled.

item.name: Vine Braid
entries: Multiple variations of this item exist, as listed below:

items: {@item Vine Braid (Uncommon)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}
{@item Vine Braid (Rare)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}
{@item Vine Braid (Very Rare)|WorldsBeyondNumberWitch}

item.name: Vine Braid (Uncommon)
entries: While holding or wearing this bracelet, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} DCs of your witch spells.

In addition, when you cast a spell using a spell slot that restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} while holding or wearing this bracelet, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} restored.

item.name: Vine Braid (Rare)
entries: While holding or wearing this bracelet, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells, and you gain a +2 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} DCs of your witch spells.

In addition, when you cast a spell using a spell slot that restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} while holding or wearing this bracelet, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} restored.

item.name: Vine Braid (Very Rare)
entries: While holding or wearing this bracelet, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells, and you gain a +3 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|attack rolls} and the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|saving throw} DCs of your witch spells.

In addition, when you cast a spell using a spell slot that restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} while holding or wearing this bracelet, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} restored.

item.name: Warder's Tocsin
entries: This talisman usually takes the form of bottle chimes, a clapperless bell, or a similar noisemaker—but its humble form belies its clever anti-divinatory properties. The tocsin can be hung from a stable hook, branch, or peg with an action. Once it's set up, if a spell such as {@spell Scrying} or {@spell Clairvoyance} creates a sensor within 60 feet of the tocsin, it chimes, rings, squawks, or toots an alarm. The tocsin itself can't be seen or heard through such sensors.
Additionally, while a sensor remains open within range of the tocsin, the image of the spell's caster is visible as a dim reflection on the tocsin's surface.

item.name: Worry Stone
entries: Often a smooth, polished stone small enough to fit in one's pocket, these talismans may also take the form of small toys, beaded bracelets, or rings a half-size too loose. When you rub, fidget, or fiddle with this talisman for one minute during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can reroll an Intelligence check or a Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check that you made since the end of your last {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, even if the subject of the check is no longer at hand, and add {@dice 1d4} to the total. A given check can only be rerolled with the {@i Worry Stone} once.
